this means that production traffic is hitting this co hitting the

of pointing your production workflow to point to the core related to the new

all the risks associated with releases you can have outages crashes uh

code is the currently current version of the code that's running on
uh production so uh releases usually in blue green involve pointing the uh
traffic from the from the current version to the new version and this
is usually achieved with the help of something like a load
balancer and that's the most common way to do it there are other ways to
obviously but i'm just talking about how it's generally done across the industry so
blue green is infrastructure level changes and the moment you point from blue
to green green takes on all the risks associated with being in a production
environment now if it's not working it's easy to roll back so that's
one of the advantages of blue-green deployments uh since blue-green deployments involve
production infrastructure this is a very useful technique to use when infrastructure level change

finish with a list of technological consideration so the first one is feature flags are
technical depth so please uh you know maintain good
development practices on feature flags remove the old ones if a feature has been fully released
remove the feature flag if it's a permanent flag then you have to keep maintaining it
but don't do not daisy chain feature flags so you know don't take 10 feature flags and add them
in sequence uh it gets really ugly there's an old uh microsoft story
uh from in i think 2013 that they did a tfs release and flipped on all the
feature flags at once and they brought down the service so uh be very careful or use the devops
principles of small batches limit the number of feature flags you're enabling and
disabling at the same time the other thing is measure everything
launch directly azure app configuration all of these is actually slightly better at the
metrics part azure configuration is getting there so uh you know you have
metrics which means you get numerical values you have logs which are recorded events so use
these two and leverage them to make sure that your feature is performing as expected
and also the number of users that are using the features feature and you want to see their new
users are even using the feature at all you know sometimes they don't so use
metrics to do all of that uh and you know i discussed a couple of frameworks and services
you can extend these so you don't have to use these if you have a different third party that
you like you can use that but make sure you're not writing your own uh framework because you know feature
flags are intended to solve business problems actually uh help the release of business
problems they do not solve a business problem on their own so focus on solving the business problem and then
encapsulate their releases with future flags do not write your own feature flag
